titleStmt.title: IN THEVETVM NOVI ORBIS peragratorem & descriptorem, Io. Auratus, literarum Graecarum Regius professor.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: IN THEVETVM NOVI ORBIS peragratorem & descriptorem, Io. Auratus, literarum Graecarum Regius professor.

monogr.title: The new found vvorlde, or Antarctike : wherin is contained wo [n] derful and strange things, as well of humaine creatures, as beastes, fishes, foules, and serpents, trées, plants, mines of golde and siluer: garnished with many learned aucthorities, trauailed and written in the French tong, by that excellent learned man, master Andrevve Theuet. And now newly translated into Englishe, wherein is reformed the errours of the auncient cosmographers
monogr.author: Thevet, André

keywords.term: Travel, topography, maps and navigational manuals

div.head: IN THEVETVM NOVI ORBIS peragratorem & descriptorem, Io. Auratus, literarum Graecarum Regius professor.
div.l: AVre tenus, sed non pedibus, nec nauibus vllis,
Multa tamen non nota maris terrae{que}ue relicta
His loca, nec certis testificata notis.
At maria & terras pariter vagus iste Theuetus
Pignora certa refert longarum haec scriptae viarum,
Ʋix quae audita alijs, subiecta fidelibus edit
Hic oculis, terra sospes ab Antipodum.
Tantum alijs hic Cosmograephis Cosmographus anteit,
